meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of an umbel.
meanings.sent1: The umbellar flowers bloomed beautifully in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The farmer planted umbellar crops in neat rows.
meanings.sent3: The umbellar pattern on the dress caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had an umbellar quality, spreading joy to all around.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted an umbellar scene with delicate brushstrokes.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to an umbel.
meanings.sent1: The chef used umbellar herbs to enhance the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent2: The botanist studied the umbellar structure of the plant.
meanings.sent3: The umbellar aroma of the soup made everyone's mouth water.
meanings.sent4: His umbellar knowledge of flowers impressed the audience.
meanings.sent5: The umbrella stand had an umbellar design, holding multiple umbrellas at once.

meanings.definition: Arranged in or forming an umbel.
meanings.sent1: The umbellar clusters of flowers attracted many bees.
meanings.sent2: The gardener carefully arranged the umbellar blooms in a vase.
meanings.sent3: The umbellar shape of the chandelier added elegance to the room.
meanings.sent4: The umbellar arrangement of lights created a warm ambiance.
meanings.sent5: The umbellar display of fruits at the market was visually appealing.
